a112-1.resolution: wq-471 completed by B session s1272. Code added directives.json mtime detection to directive-outcome.js (line 197-207). However, R session s1275 still shows addressed=[] because urgentDirectives=[] — R sessions are assigned no urgent directives by the assignment logic, so the per-directive evidence loop never executes. The fix is technically correct but targets the wrong layer: the problem is in directive assignment, not evidence detection.
a112-1.metric_before: R sessions 0% addressed rate (2/2: s1265, s1270)
a112-1.metric_after: R session s1275 still 0% addressed rate — urgentDirectives=[] means evidence loop never runs

a112-2.note: Continue monitoring. No new wq item needed yet.

recommended_actions.description: R session directive-outcomes tracking shows 0% addressed rate across all tracked R sessions (3/3: s1265, s1270, s1275). Two fix attempts failed: wq-459 (tracking) and wq-471 (mtime detection). Root cause: directive assignment logic gives R sessions urgentDirectives=[], so evidence loop is skipped. This is the 2nd consecutive audit with degradation. Previous fixes targeted wrong layer.
recommended_actions.action: B session should update createDirectiveAssignments to include active directives in R session urgentDirectives array, so the existing evidence detection (including wq-471 mtime check) can actually run.
